NewWords.WordPhrase: n. 享用（或接近、进入）的机会
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Every student has free access to the library.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. arrangement made with a bank to pay in or take out money; description 账，账户; 描述，记述
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Will you add the cost of this skirt to my account as I haven't any money with me?

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. take and use as one's own 采纳，采取
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He adopted his friend's ideas.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. happening or done every year or once a year 每年的；一年一次的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Here's the annual report of this company, read through it and you'll know better about the company.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. a sum of money paid into a bank account 存款   v. put (money) into a bank account 储蓄
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I'd like to make a deposit, please.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. think out; invent 想出，设计；发现
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They devised a plan for getting the jewels out of the country.

NewWords.WordPhrase: find oneself in a situation that is not intended or expected 以…而告终
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. If you don't know what you want, you might end up getting something you don't want.
e.g. The exercise is worth the cost from my point of view.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. (usu.pl) sum of money saved or for a particular purpose 存款；基金; 专款
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His parents set up a fund for his college education.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. in addition, moreover 此外，而且
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The house is too small, and furthermore, it's expensive.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. have in mind as a purpose or plan 打算
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Nobody knows what David intends to do after graduation.

NewWords.WordPhrase: follow the development of; keep in touch with 跟上…的发展；与…保持联系
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Part of your task is to keep track of the business performance of that company.

NewWords.WordPhrase: when demanded 一经要求，承索
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Passengers must show their ticket on demand.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. speed or rate of development, movement, etc. 速度
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The old man walked at a very slow pace.

NewWords.WordPhrase: prep. with the addition of 加，加上
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Two plus five is seven.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. express strong disagreement or disapproval about (sth.) 抗议，反对
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Customers are protesting against higher prices.
e.g. That country is rich in natural resources.
e.g. This is undoubtedly a good chance for improving your language skill.
